headline: UPS drivers to receive buyout offer as company shrinks parcel network
summary: UPS will offer an early retirement package to drivers as it looks to cull 20,000 workers amid slower parcel growth. The post UPS drivers to receive buyout offer as company shrinks parcel network appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: UPS Offers Buyouts to Drivers, a First in Its 117-Year History
summary: The company is cutting costs because of flat parcel volumes, rising labor costs and a long stock-price slide.

headline: UPS to offer voluntary buyout packages to its US drivers
summary: The Atlanta-based company had in April announced a network reconfiguration plan following a reduction in deliveries for its key customer, Amazon.com, and amid U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.  The buyout package is in addition to any retirement benefits such as pension and healthcare, the company said in a statement.

headline: Meta, FedEx, Oracle: Trending Tickers
summary: Meta (META) was upgraded to Hold from Underperform by Needham analyst Laura Martin, citing higher employee productivity than Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN). FedEx (FDX) was upgraded to Outperform from Underperform by BNP Paribas after the company outperformed rival UPS (UPS) in volume and yield growth. Oracle (ORCL) is expanding its cloud deal with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) by reportedly renting out 4.5 gigawatts of data-center power to the company, according to Bloomberg. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: UPS VIOLATES TEAMSTERS NATIONAL CONTRACT WITH PLAN FOR BUYOUTS
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) is expected to unveil an illegal plan later this month to buyout full-time employees represented by the Teamsters, a corporate scheme that will directly violate the union's national contract protecting 340,000 delivery workers.
